location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 33/2 Supply of News Telegrams (Reuters/WT Press) for Agency.'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file, except where enclosures of an earlier date are filed after their relevant covering letter, and terminate in a set of notes (folios 14-18).

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 20; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is also present between ff 3-9; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and are located in the same position as the main sequence

mods.abstract: The file concerns a proposal by the Political Agency, Bahrain to distribute copies of world news telegrams among selected organisations in Bahrain (including the American Mission) in exchange for a small subscription. The papers indicate that most of the organisations contacted were not interested in receiving the telegrams. The main correspondent is the Political Agent, Bahrain (Lieutenant-Colonel Percy Gordon Loch).
